sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: Reporting is a module that provides a reporting abilities. It is configured using <reporting> element in the scenario definition.
The configuration consists of following steps:

The reporter class represents a different types of the reports such as average throughput or memory usage. By configuring the destinations you tell where output should be directed by the reporter (e.g. console, CSV file, etc.).

simplesect.title: Example reporting configuration:
simplesect.programlisting:
<reporting> <reporter class="AverageThroughputReporter"> <destination class="ConsoleDestination"> <period type="time" value="1000"/> </destination> <destination class="CSVDestination"> <period type="time" value="2000"/> <property name="path" value="test-average-throughput.csv"/> </destination> </reporter>
<reporter class="MemoryUsageReporter"> <property name="agentHostname" value="localhost"/> <property name="agentPort" value="8849"/> <destination class="CSVDestination"> <period type="time" value="2000"/> <property name="path" value="test-memory-usage.csv"/> </destination> </reporter> </reporting>

sect1.para:
With this configuration the 2 reporters are specified -
and MemoryUsageReporter . First one will report to console each 1 second and to CSV file each 2 seconds, The memory usage reporter will report memory usage of the tested system into CSV file each 2 seconds.
